page.title: 03Whittington Parish Church
page.content: {Whittington Parish Church}has the largest unsupported roof in Shropshire .The rector is Rev.S.Frost. There are three services each Sunday, Holy Communion at 8.00a.m. and 10.30a.m. and evensong at 6.30p.m.. Every first Sunday of the month there is a family service at which members of the the choir receive medals for attendance during the month.There is a choir practice every Friday from 6.30p.m. to 7.30p.m..A bell ringing class meets on Tuesdays and Thursdays. The bells are rung for Sunday services except communion .The church is dedicated to St John the Baptist and the school children celebrate the patronal fesival on 24th June.William Walsham How,the hymn writer,was Whittington's most famous rector.The church tower was built in the early 18th century and the rest in 1896.
